title: Palantir, BorgWarner, Occidental Petroleum: What to Watch When the Stock Market Opens Today
sub_head: U.S. stock futures climbed, signaling major indexes could notch fresh records
body:
Here’s what we’re watching ahead of Tuesday’s trading action.
—U.S. stock futures climbed, signaling major indexes could notch record highs in their first trading session after the Presidents Day holiday. Futures tied to both the S&P 500 and the tech-heavy Nasdaq-100 rose 0.5%. Yields on 10-year Treasurys also gained. Read more in our full market wrap.
Bitcoin briefly traded above $50,000 for the first time, marking a milestone in the cryptocurrency’s rapid climb. Bitcoin slipped back, and was recently up 4.9% at $49,867.56, according to CoinDesk.
—Earnings season rolls on, with Avis Budget results due after markets close.
—On the conference circuit, Barclays and Citigroup are both hosting events focusing on the industrial sector.
